attributes.action: Ban mobile phones being on loud in offices or any quiet workplace.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There is simply nothing more annoying, distracting or counter-productive than someone's phone going off in the office. 

It is bad enough when it is simply a normal, yet invariably deafeningly loud tone. However, the even worse situation, which happens far more often, is when the ringtone is the call of an exotic bird, the theme tune of some thankfully long forgotten TV programme, or worst of all their children going "Daddy, Daddy, pick up the phone". 

This is made all the worse when people have left their mobiles on their desk and the phone rings anything up to 8 times in the hour they're away for lunch, before someone disparingly picks it up, shakes it around and finally discovers how to put it on silent.

Something has to be done.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
